section: i-on will schedule and perform such maintenance during any time of the day, including weekdays.
explanation: This clause gives i-on the right to perform website maintenance at any time, even during peak usage hours on weekdays. While necessary for upkeep, it directly contradicts the expectation of 'continuous' operation (24/7) promised earlier in the agreement, as maintenance inevitably leads to service interruptions.

section: The Customer is responsible for paying i-on the recurring monthly fee in the amount of $450. The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees by the 20th day of each month beginning in April 1, 1999.
explanation: The original agreement includes the incorrect beginning date for the recurring monthly fees, which could lead to disputes over the invoincing. There is no real explanation of when the fees actually begin.

section: This Agreement shall automatically be renewed for one (1) or more one (1) month periods unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the Agreement, which notice must be given not less than five (5) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term. Either party may terminate this Agreement without cause at any time effective upon thirty (30) days' written notice.
explanation: The text indicates contradictory terms, as the agreement allows for auto-renewal, but it also allows for termination of the agreement without cause. The two are contradictory in nature, as the two seem to negate each other, as the contract can always just be terminated.
